awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  Feasibility of an L5 GPS-Based Tsunami Detection and Alerting System
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader/commercial impact of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project is in the development and deployment of an effective, affordable, and globally accessible detection and alert system for tsunamis on coastlines worldwide. Tsunamis are among the most significant ways in which the ocean impacts human civilization. With the increasing population density along coastlines and the global rise in sea levels, the potential for tsunamis to cause unprecedented harm is higher than ever. The proposed product providing enhanced wave height and arrival time maps to its customers could provide significantly more timely alerts to at-risk populations, providing them with essential evacuation information and crucial hours to prepare for approaching waves. This could herald a major shift in tsunami preparedness and resilience. This technology offers wide-ranging benefits for various groups and industries such as small island economies, defense operations, and commercial port operators.


To develop these capabilities, this project proposes a buoy-deployable software product that takes advantage of new generations of Global Positioning System (GPS) to detect tsunamis at sea, hours before they make landfall. It will use revolutionary advancements in GPS technology, particularly in vertical accuracy, to detect, prepare for, and mitigate the formidable threat of tsunamis. For the first time, new generations of GPS provide sufficient resolution to detect the subtle vertical displacement of the ocean surface caused by passing tsunami waves with a single receiver even in open ocean.  The project will focus on the development of novel methods of signal classification using Dense Neural Network (DNN) and optimize them with rapid Machine Learning (ML) methods. This is expected to help demonstrate that tsunami signatures can be perceived in real-time by low-cost and low-power on-edge processing capabilities. When this new on-edge technology is deployed on widespread ocean buoys, it would form a robust tsunami detection network. These buoys will serve as sentinels, capable of sensing distinct sea level changes that signal an impending tsunami.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

A Smarter Approach to Tsunami Detection

HyperKelp produced a tsunami detection algorithm that is hosted aboard the company’s Kelp Smart Buoy (KSB). Each of these floating sensor platforms is equipped with L5 GPS, barometers, and AI-driven data processing. Unlike traditional tsunami detection methods, which rely on expensive, submerged pressure sensors, HyperKelp’s buoys remain on the ocean’s surface. Using the KSB’s surface-based sensors, the AI-driven tsunami detection algorithm continuously monitors changes in sea surface height. Because this solution is deployed to buoys as a ridesharing software payload, HyperKelp can provide real time tsunami measurements as a data service. This avoids the need for government and commercial customers to purchase expensive and failure-prone tsunami sensor systems.

Key Features of HyperKelp's System:

  • Advanced GPS Technology – The buoys use L5 GPS signals to measure tiny changes in sea level, identifying tsunami waves more precisely than existing methods.

  • Machine Learning Algorithms – AI-driven models analyze sensor data to distinguish between normal ocean activity and tsunami signals.

  • Real-Time Data Transmission – The system is designed to deliver tsunami alerts in under one minute, significantly faster than current systems.

  • Scalability & Cost-Effectiveness – With lower maintenance costs and widespread deployment potential, this system provides many more data points than traditional tsunami sensors at a fraction of the cost.

How It Works: Detecting Tsunamis in Real-Time

  • Sensor Payload: Each KSB is equipped with a GPS module, an inertial measurement unit (IMU), and a barometer, which work together to detect slight changes in sea surface height.

  • Data Collection & Processing: The sensors collect altitude and pressure data, filtering out noise from wind waves and ocean currents.

  • AI-Powered Detection: A convolutional neural network (CNN) analyzes the data, distinguishing between typical ocean movement and actual tsunami waves.

  • Alert Generation & Transmission: If a tsunami is detected, the system immediately transmits a warning signal via satellite, ensuring authorities receive critical information within 30 seconds.

In tests, HyperKelp’s system demonstrated over 99% accuracy in detecting tsunami signals of one meter or larger, making it one of the most reliable tsunami detection technologies to date.

Economic & Societal Impact

Tsunamis don’t just pose a risk to human lives—they also have massive economic consequences. In California alone, over $35 billion in property and 15,000 businesses are located in tsunami-prone areas. By improving early warnings, HyperKelp's technology could prevent billions of dollars in losses and save thousands of lives.

Potential Benefits:

  • Faster Evacuations: Earlier warnings mean more time for coastal communities to evacuate.

  • Reduced Economic Disruptions: Businesses, ports, and infrastructure can take protective measures in advance.

  • Lower Costs for Governments & Insurers: Improved accuracy means fewer false alarms, leading to more efficient disaster response efforts.

By increasing detection points from fewer than 40 (DART buoys) to potentially thousands of KSB sensors, HyperKelp aims to dramatically enhance global tsunami monitoring while keeping costs low.

The Road Ahead: Expanding Deployment

HyperKelp has already tested its technology in real-world ocean conditions and is now preparing for large-scale deployment. With support from commercial and government customers, the company plans to:

  • Expand its fleet of smart buoys, improving global tsunami detection coverage.

  • Enhance AI algorithms to further refine accuracy and minimize false alarms.

  • Integrate data into global early warning systems, ensuring seamless coordination with NOAA, FEMA, and international disaster agencies.

By making high-quality tsunami detection data accessible on a subscription basis, HyperKelp is creating a scalable, sustainable model that benefits governments, businesses, and scientific researchers alike.

Conclusion: A New Era of Tsunami Preparedness

HyperKelp's Tsunami Alert System (TAS) represents a major breakthrough in ocean monitoring and disaster response. With affordable, AI-powered smart buoys, this system provides low-cost, faster, and more reliable tsunami warnings, reducing risks to lives, property, and global economies.

As HyperKelp moves toward full deployment, its new approach is set to revolutionize tsunami forecasting worldwide, offering coastal communities a smarter, more resilient future.
